rev.comment: /* The first self-labelled anarchist */ Adding relevant Proudhon quotes
not the radical party but the definition which is on the da page itself
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ i don't think his opinion is of particular relevance, especially given his clear leanings and friendship to rothbard
/* Criticisms of anarchism */ npov and citeneeded tag
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ how convenient to leave out a crucial word in the quote. let's put the full quote in.
Adding another quote from Molinari and a quote from Hart on why he rejected anarchism.
/* The first self-labelled anarchist */ removing "individual" as have proved that Proudhon argued for collective ownership of workplaces by workers so use of "Individual" misleading.
/* The first self-labelled anarchist */ put back in "individual possession" with quote
all anarchisms overlap at least in some way
but a lot of anarchists do see a single "anarchism"; few anarchists identify any more specifically, even if individualists almost always do
add template to bottom of page
/* Origins and predecessors */ eugh... it looks ugly...
/* Criticisms of anarchism */ reword to avoid anarchists sounding puritanical
/* Anarchist communism */ merge link to title and reduce quote
/* External links */ wikilink to an anarchist faq
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ Hardly be considered as "replacements" for government if Molinari called them governments!
Changing it back as not POV.
removing "coercive" as *adding* it in the first place was hardly a minor change.
added "coercive" back, that was not a minor edit
/* The first self-labelled anarchist */ Removing distorting references to "individual" possession, added relevant references on collective ownership and opposition to wage labour.
Removing "coercive" for obvious reasons -- voluntary fascism is hardly anarchism.
governments are compatible with anarchism as long as they aren't coercive
/* External links */ change to infoshop.org host (the geocities site is sometimes down)
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ Some NPOV improvements and corrected Molinari comment
move paragraphs as suggested in talk page
/* The First International */ Changed link for Mutualists from biological Mutualism to sociological Mutualism
/* Cultural phenomena */ added Jeff Monson, Anarchist UFC fighter
/* The first self-labelled anarchist */ proudhon explicitly says "individual possession"
/* The first self-labelled anarchist */ removing fact as evidence is immediately provided!
/* The first self-labelled anarchist */ proudhon is not "like communists" ..that's a stretch. also requesting a source that proudhon was against laboring for wages
Removed irrelevant, personal message between 1st two paragraphs.
although I agree with your POV, this is a controversial subject so please do not make changes like that without consensus (which we will never have)
/* Anarchist communism */ Adding quotes to show that communist-anarchism supports possession rather than property.
/* The first self-labelled anarchist */ noting this is "individual" possession, lest someone confuses this with communist possession
/* The first self-labelled anarchist */ slight change to note that Proudhon opposed property in workplaces, land, etc. while supporting property in the product of labour.
/* The first self-labelled anarchist */ did not support it; accepted it
/* Anarchist communism */ private properrty in houses, fields, and factories would by abolished
/* The first self-labelled anarchist */ kropotkin did not condemn proudhon for it, only disagreed
/* The first self-labelled anarchist */ wage and wage labor are the same thing. proudhon supported this. see talk.
/* The first self-labelled anarchist */ kropotkin also criticized for support of private property ..no surprise there
/* Religious anarchism */ link [[Islam and anarchism]], and briefly note Gary Snyder
/* The first self-labelled anarchist */ Clarifying Proudhon's ideas on "wages" and showing his opposition to wage labour.
/* The first self-labelled anarchist */ source for kropotkin oppose proudhon for supporting private property and wage labor
/* Other branches and offshoots */ Postanarchism (not poststructuralism)
/* The first self-labelled anarchist */ property and possession - see Talk
links to articles in french are decidedly not helpful
/* The first self-labelled anarchist */ kropotkin condemend proudhon for private property and wages
/* Other issues */ collaborative development and FS / OSS
if you checked them, than you know that you're wrong
I removed the superfluous links on solitary years, in accordance with the Manual of Style. See [[WP:DATES]] for reasons. (This was not done by a bot; I check each change individually.)
/* The First International */ ref format, redirect bypass
redirect bypass, rm broken link, ref format
/* Other branches and offshoots */ Changed "1960s and 1970s" to "1960's and 1970's".~~~~Writtenright
/* Anarchism in the labour movement */ Changed "workers solidarity" to "workers' solidarity".~~~~Writtenright
/* Anarchism in the labour movement */ Changed "General Confederation of Work" to "General Confederation of Labour"; changed "socities" to "societies".~~~~Writtenright
/* Propaganda of the deed */ Changed "propaganda by the deed" to "propaganda of the deed" (twice) to make noun phrase consistent with sectional heading.~~~~Writtenright
/* The First International */ Changed "gained to power" to "came to power".~~~~Writtenright
/* The first self-labelled anarchist */ link to economic theory of mutualism, not biology
/* Origins and predecessors */ Russell Means link to libertarian socialism not libertarian
inserted "anarchism" for "anarchist ethos", anti-voting is a fundamental tenet to anarchism
anarchists actually do set up these organizations, so "trying" is not accurate

/* The first self-labelled anarchist */ print friendly

/* Cultural phenomena */ Add V for Vendetta
/* Criticisms of anarchism */ change dilettante link from Dilettante Society to wiktionary definition
/* Religious anarchism */ rv line per talk page
/* The Russian Revolution */ removed residual parenthesis
/* Anarchism and feminism */ ifeminism isn't anarchist
/* Anarchism and feminism */ how is this information even relevant to feminism? also, de cleyre wasn't always an individualist anarchist, and her aim was primary to unite individualism and communism
/* Anarchism and feminism */ summarise quote instead
rv Sarge's POV edit. De Cleyre supporte anarch*ism*. Info highly relevant; removal only supports a POV about what you think anarchism means
/* Anarchism and feminism */ rv pov fluff. this article is about anarchism, not anarchists; anyway, de cleyre eventually abandoned individualism
vandalism from [[User talk:67.81.24.54]] (44419244) - reverted to [[User talk:CalebNoble]] (44339142)
--> lead section - corrected Thomas Rainsborough quote
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ restructure, another note about molinari
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ gr; gustave de molinari did not call himself an anarchist and so should not be used as ref
/* Max Stirner's egoism */ link, "individualistically-inclined anarchist" is redundant
/* Anarchist Communism */ always use internal links; style; link to collectivist anarchism instead of collectivism- they are distinct
/* Anarchist Communism */ proudhon not specifically anti-communist
/* Anarchist Communism */ add point and ref
/* Anarchism and the environment */ style, reordering by relevance
/* Criticisms of anarchism */ restoring hypocrisy. it's not hypocritical for a president to be sexist, where it is for an anarchist
/* Criticisms of anarchism */ Removed biased criticisms, Simply capitalist POV. As for sexism, why isn the sexism and racism of US presidents pointed out in their wiki entries?
/* Anarchism and the environment */ - added some much-needed mention of other green anarchists (let's be fair folks, please)
/* Books */ remove headings - no need for ostracision
correct spelling, tidy, and general clean up using [[Wikipedia:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
/* Criticisms of anarchism */ gave nationalism its own criticism again - see talk
National anarchism belongs in the hypocricy section because it is hypocritical for anarchists to support nationalistic/racist ideas. If you disagree, we should discuss it on the talk page.
getting rid of "Anarchism, Racism and Nationalism" section and adding info on national anarchism to the Criticism section (see talk)
clean up, typo correction, and other changes using [[Wikipedia:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
/* American individualist anarchism */ more colonial roots
/* Cultural phenomena */ readding situationists and autonomists per talk page.
/* American individualist anarchism */ - note influence by older rebellions. Could use double checking by an actual historian, but ought to be mentioned!
/* Cultural phenomena */ remove situationists, autonomists etc
switching opening paragraphs; most important information needs to be on top. does anyone else think it odd both begin by telling us "anarchism is derived from" such and such a word?
/* Anarchist Communism */ trim unnecessary and irrelevant links
/* Propaganda of the deed */ link fix
/* Anarchism in the labour movement */ the right to work
revert - please discuss on the talk page first
/* Anarchist Communism */ what they oppose most is money

governments->governing bodies, so people don't confuse the term with "state"
i don't think anarchism can be called a "form of government" because then it would be opposed to itself

citation for anarchism as term of abuse during french rev.

Anarcho-capitalism section replaced with the shortened version from talk page (if missing something, try to take info from previous versions and put here rather than revert)

I'm removing the primary sourced tag - this page is now sourced better than the vast majority on wikipedia

revert (someone's edits broke the other language links) changed title to "other types" and Tucker DID oppose class division

remove {{npov}} per lack of discussion on talk page
Removing a redundant tag, basically same as {{primarysources}} in intent
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ spelling "many" and individualists believe in labor based private ownership
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ stop spamming the article with tags; also, stop saying the FAQ writers were communists
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ pov problem here as well, since Infinity won't allow it to be known that the FAQ was written by communists. Individualists were not allowed to contribute.
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ moved pov tag to proper location
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ social anarchist is a neologism made up by the FAQ. you have to say what it means.
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ dispute tag. do not remove this, Infinity.
you're taking away focus from the main point of the paragraph, which is class distinction, and a similarity
that is a similarity, they both oppose class distinction, which is the point of the paragraph.
the point of the paragraph is anti-capitalism, which you deleted all references to in that version
that's already mentioned in the notes; "self-described" is weasel words which implies they are fake
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ noting that the anarchist FAQ was written by communists
the article does not make those claims, please stop trying to equate An Anarchist FAQ with communists
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ don't try to equate tucker with communists
please stop deleting information about the class distinction
please stop deleting information about the class distinction
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ it's not similar, but different
a contrast to what? they are both attacking capitalist structures; it's a similarity
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ it's not similar. individualst don't oppose private ownership of the means of production
please don't remove information. it says he allowed wages, and the "distinction must be wiped out" is a similarity
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ why mention anarcho-communists; the section doesn't mention them
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ it's not similar at all to the communist position.
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ he does NOT express opposition to wages, but SUPPORT of wages
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ reworded things a bit; let's remember that this is flowing from the criticism paragraph
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ this is NOT "similiarly" to the anarcho-communists.
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ it misleads the reader to say he didnt want to "prohibite employment outright." He didnt want to prohibit it AT ALL. He actually SUPPORTED it.
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ similarity is the distinction; moved quote along to relevant part
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ important to note that he doesnt want to abolish wages, unlike the communists
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ some anarcho-communists believe in private labour products
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ occupancy and use doesn't apply to "workplaces"
